feature.name: Acestes
feature.origin: King of Sicily.

feature.name: Adrastus
feature.origin: King of Argos, one of the seven against Thebes, and the only one to return alive.

feature.name: Aeneas
feature.origin: Hero of the Aeneid. The son of Anchises and Venus and a member of the royal family of Troy.

feature.name: Alcander
feature.origin: A Trojan defending Aeneas’ camp against the Rutulians, killed by Turnus.

feature.name: Allecto
feature.origin: One of the Furies.

feature.name: Amastrus
feature.origin: A Trojan, victim of Camilla.

feature.name: Amata
feature.origin: Mother of Lavinia (wife of Aeneas).

feature.name: Amycus
feature.origin: A Trojan, comrade of Aeneas.

feature.name: Anchises
feature.origin: Aeneas' father.

feature.name: Anna
feature.origin: Sister and confidante of Dido.

feature.name: Antenor
feature.origin: Nephew of Priam. He escaped the fall of Troy and reached Italy before Aeneas, where he founded Padua.

feature.name: Argiletum Fossae
feature.origin: A district of Rome near the Forum.

feature.name: Arpi Fossae
feature.origin: Town in Apulia (now Puglia, southern Italy) founded after the Trojan war by Diomedes.

feature.name: Ascanius
feature.origin: Son of Aeneas by Creusa.

feature.name: Assaracus
feature.origin: Early king of Troy, son of Tros, brother of Ilus and Ganymede.

feature.name: Aufidus Catena
feature.origin: River in the Apulian territory of Diomedes, now called the Ofanto.

feature.name: Aulestes
feature.origin: Etruscan chief, ally of Aeneas.

feature.name: Aurunca Chasmata
feature.origin: An old town in Campania.

feature.name: Butes
feature.origin: A famous boxer who had been defeated by Dares.

feature.name: Caieta
feature.origin: A nurse of Aeneas.

feature.name: Camilla
feature.origin: A warrior maiden; ally of Turnus.

feature.name: Carthage Fossae
feature.origin: A Punic (Phoenician) city in North Africa.

feature.name: [Carthage Linea]
feature.origin: A Punic (Phoenician) city in North Africa.

feature.name: Cassandra
feature.origin: Daughter of Priam; she could foretell the future.

feature.name: Catillus
feature.origin: Brother of Tiburtus and twin brother of Coras.

feature.name: Clusium Fossae
feature.origin: One of the twelve chief cities of Etruria, situated on the river Clanis.

feature.name: Coras
feature.origin: Brother of Tiburtus and twin brother of Catillus. He was founder of Tibur and an ally of Turnus against Aeneas.

feature.name: Cretheus
feature.origin: A Trojan warrior who took part in the defense of Aeneas’ camp against the Rutulians.

feature.name: Creusa
feature.origin: Daughter of Priam; first wife of Aeneas.

feature.name: Daucus
feature.origin: A Rutulian, father of the twins Thymber and Larides.

feature.name: Dercennus
feature.origin: Ancient king of the Laurentians.

feature.name: Dido
feature.origin: Tyrian princess who founded Carthage.

feature.name: Drepanum Chasma
feature.origin: Coastal town of Sicily where Aeneas found a safe harbor during a raging storm, and where Anchises died.

feature.name: Entellus
feature.origin: Sicilian boxing champion.

feature.name: Erulus
feature.origin: Superhuman son of the goddess Feronia.

feature.name: Eumelus
feature.origin: A Trojan companion of Aeneas.

feature.name: Eurotas Chasmata
feature.origin: The river on which Sparta stood.

feature.name: Euryalus
feature.origin: A Trojan companion of Aeneas, friend of Nisus.

feature.name: Evander
feature.origin: Son of Mercury by Carmentis, ally of Aeneas against the Latins, mythical king of Arcadia, founded and ruled Pallanteum, built on the future site of Rome.

feature.name: Fadus
feature.origin: A Rutulian of those besieging the men of Aeneas in their leader’s absence.

feature.name: Fidena Fossae
feature.origin: Town in Latium near Rome.

feature.name: Galaesus
feature.origin: An old Italian killed in the first fighting between Latins and Trojans while trying to make peace.

feature.name: Haemon
feature.origin: There are two persons in the Aeneid with this name: (a) a Rutulian from a group attacking the Trojan’s camp in the absence of Aeneas, and (b) an Italian whose son, priest of Apollo and Diana, was a soldier of Turnus.

feature.name: Halys
feature.origin: A Trojan defending Aeneas' camp against the Rutulian attack. He was killed by Turnus.

feature.name: Helorus Fossa
feature.origin: A river in southeastern Sicily with wide marshes near its mouth.

feature.name: Herbesus
feature.origin: A Rutulian who besieged Aeneas' camp.

feature.name: Himella Fossa
feature.origin: A river of the Sabines, affluent of the Tiber.

feature.name: Iasus
feature.origin: There are two persons in the Aeneid with this name: (a) father of Palinurus, and (b) father of Iapyx.

feature.name: Ilia
feature.origin: Also known as Rhea Silvia; Mother by Mars of Romulus and Remus, the founders of Rome.

feature.name: Italus
feature.origin: Ancient hero, eponymous ancestor of the Italians.

feature.name: Janiculum Dorsa
feature.origin: Hill across the Tiber river from Rome.

feature.name: Lagus
feature.origin: A soldier of Turnus.

feature.name: Lamyrus
feature.origin: A Rutulian with the troops besieging the camp of Aeneas.

feature.name: Larides
feature.origin: A Rutulian, member of Turnus’ army, son of Daucus, twin brother of Thymber.

feature.name: Larissa Chasma
feature.origin: A town in Thessaly, Achilles' native region.

feature.name: Latagus
feature.origin: Soldier of Aeneas.

feature.name: Latinus
feature.origin: King of Latium, husband of Amata.

feature.name: Latium Chasma
feature.origin: The Trojans' promised land in Italy.

feature.name: Lausus
feature.origin: Son of Mezentius, killed by Aeneas.

feature.name: Liger
feature.origin: Soldier of Turnus, brother of Lucagus.

feature.name: Lucagus
feature.origin: Soldier of Turnus, brother of Liger.

feature.name: Magus
feature.origin: A soldier of Turnus, killed by Aeneas.

feature.name: Massicus
feature.origin: An Etruscan ally of Aeneas.

feature.name: Metiscus
feature.origin: A Rutulian, charioteer of Turnus.

feature.name: Mezentius
feature.origin: Etruscan king, ally of Turnus, father of Lausus.

feature.name: Murranus
feature.origin: A Rutulian.

feature.name: Nisus
feature.origin: Trojan companion of Aeneas, friend of Euryalus.

feature.name: Oebalus
feature.origin: An ally of Turnus, son of Telon and Sebethis.

feature.name: Pactolus Catena
feature.origin: A Lydian river said to carry gold dust after King Midas washed off his golden touch in its waters.

feature.name: Padua Chasmata
feature.origin: City in northern Italy founded by Antenor.

feature.name: [Padua Linea]
feature.origin: City in Northern Italy founded by Antenor.

feature.name: Pagasus
feature.origin: An Etruscan killed by Camilla.

feature.name: Palatine Chasmata
feature.origin: One of the Seven Hills of Rome.

feature.name: [Palatine Linea]
feature.origin: One of the Seven Hills of Rome.

feature.name: Palinurus
feature.origin: Pilot of Aeneas' fleet.

feature.name: Pantagias Catenae
feature.origin: River of Sicily.

feature.name: Petelia Fossae
feature.origin: Town of Lucania in southern Italy, founded by Philoctetes.

feature.name: Phaleris
feature.origin: Trojan defending Aeneas' camp against Rutulian attack.

feature.name: Phorbas
feature.origin: A Trojan, companion of Aeneas.

feature.name: Prytanis
feature.origin: Trojan defending Aeneas' camp against Rutulian attack.

feature.name: Remus
feature.origin: He and his brother Romulus founded Rome.

feature.name: Ripheus
feature.origin: A Trojan. He fought at the side of Aeneas during Troy's last night.

feature.name: Romulus
feature.origin: Mythical founder of Rome in 754 or 753 B.C., son of Mars by Ilia (Rhea Silvia).

feature.name: Sabinus
feature.origin: Fabled ancestor of the Sabines.

feature.name: Sagaris
feature.origin: Servant of Aeneas.

feature.name: Salius
feature.origin: There are two persons in the Aeneid with this name: (a) a companion of Aeneas and a contestant in the foot race, and (b) a Rutulian.

feature.name: Silvius
feature.origin: Son of Aeneas and Lavinia.

feature.name: Sulmo
feature.origin: There are two persons in the Aeneid with this name: (a) a Rutulian in the troop of Volcens, and (b) an Italian whose sons fought for Turnus.

feature.name: Telon
feature.origin: Ruler of the Teleboans on Capri; father of Oebalus.

feature.name: Tereus
feature.origin: A Trojan, killed by Camilla.

feature.name: Thymber
feature.origin: A Rutulian, member of Turnus’ army, son of Daucus, twin brother of Larides.

feature.name: Tibur Chasmata
feature.origin: Ancient town of Italy (modern name Tivoli) not far from Rome on the river Anio.

feature.name: Tiburtus
feature.origin: Brother of the twins Catillus and Coras, founder of Tibur to which he gave his name.

feature.name: Turnus
feature.origin: Rutililan king; Aeneas' rival for hand of Lavinia.

feature.name: Tyrrhus
feature.origin: Keeper of the herds for Latinus, father of Silvia.

feature.name: Volcens
feature.origin: A Latin, leader of cavalry sent as reinforcements to Turnus.
